private_information: I can only pick and place blocks labeled with vowel letters: A E I O U
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final single stack from bottom to top is K J I H G F E D C B A with K on the table

private_information: I can only pick and place blocks labeled with consonant letters: B C D F G H J K
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final single stack from bottom to top is K J I H G F E D C B A with K on the table

private_information: I coordinate contributions from the vowel and consonant agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for a planner
orchestrator.goal: Produce a consolidated PDDL domain and problem that encodes the block rearrangement task for the FastDownwards solver

public_information: There are 11 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K
Only the top block of any stack can be picked up and moved
Agents may only move one block at a time
Initial stacks on the table are two stacks. Stack one bottom to top: D K A H G B. Stack two bottom to top: F E I J C
Initial explicit relations: D is on the table, K is on D, A is on K, H is on A, G is on H, B is on G, F is on the table, E is on F, I is on E, J is on I, C is on J
One agent is restricted to vowels and the other to consonants. Vowel agent can act on A E I. Consonant agent can act on B C D F G H J K
The global goal is to have a single stack bottom to top: K J I H G F E D C B A with K on the table

pddl.system_prompt: You are the vowel agent. Provide a clear factual description of what you can perceive and do. List which blocks you are allowed to move, which of those are currently at stack tops given the public information, and describe in plain structured text the primitive move actions you can perform and any local constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL. Provide concise observations and suggested action schemas in natural language or simple structured lists.
pddl.prompt: Agent name: vowel_agent. Use the public information and your private information to produce: 1) A list of vowel blocks you can move. 2) The current top blocks among those vowels according to the public initial configuration. 3) A description of the primitive move operation you can perform including preconditions and effects in plain text. 4) Any assumptions or missing information you detect. Keep the output precise and machine-friendly but do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the consonant agent. Provide a clear factual description of what you can perceive and do. List which blocks you are allowed to move, which of those are currently at stack tops given the public information, and describe in plain structured text the primitive move actions you can perform and any local constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL. Provide concise observations and suggested action schemas in natural language or simple structured lists.
pddl.prompt: Agent name: consonant_agent. Use the public information and your private information to produce: 1) A list of consonant blocks you can move. 2) The current top blocks among those consonants according to the public initial configuration. 3) A description of the primitive move operation you can perform including preconditions and effects in plain text. 4) Any assumptions or missing information you detect. Keep the output precise and machine-friendly but do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the observations and action schemas provided by the vowel and consonant agents. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the initial configuration and the goal configuration for the block rearrangement task. The produced PDDL should be suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Keep agent-specific actions distinct and explicit if necessary. Ensure predicates for on, ontable, clear, holding, and handempty are present and consistent.
pddl.prompt: You will receive two agent analyses. Use them to produce a final PDDL domain and a final PDDL problem ready for FastDownwards. Incorporate constraints that only top blocks may be moved and that one agent moves vowels while the other moves consonants. Keep actions names and predicates clear. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem>.
